column5: my son put a lowrance 332 on my skiff but he said the gps doesn't work because the puck (external antenae) he has doesn't work, i was wondering if any one on this site has an old one they aren't using, i don't know what they are worth so if you have one, let me know how much you would like for it. maybe we can make a deal
Fishermans Warehouse in Woodstock will have one.  His supply of old cables and such borders on hoarder.

i tried to find a phone number for this and Canada 411 had no listing, neither did bell directory assistance, I cannot find a web site for it either, can you provide a number to call or a web page to go to
I have 2 that looks like this,the other one one I posted was for a complete working unit I would  get rid of one of these,sorry for the confusion and yes I do have the y cables also
i'll snap a pic of the back of the unit and post it, maybe you can tell by the pic if yours will work, it should be on the thread by tomorrow

I googled the 332 unit and came up with a manual that shows the back of the unit and the puck they are saying that goes with the unit is a LGC2000 module antenna. it also looks like it is supposed to connect to a y adapter cable before it goes into the unit itself. do you have one of the cables that connects to the unit?
if this one is what you need its yours for free, I'm in Dryden so not far for you to come get it.
There's a good chance I'll be coming through Dryden October 8 and will be able to pick up and deliver the puck right to Bill's front door.  Let me know.
thanks for the offer Connie, Simon, I will check and see if my son still has his defective puck and see what it looks like if he has it. I will get back to you asap.
this is the back of the unit so you can see the connection points

Bill, I ran across information about GPS Module Compatibility.   It appears that the unit in Dryden will work with a Lowrance LMS-332 C  (sonar/gps).   PM your email address and I'll forward the complete information, but it may take a while as I'm going to be away from my computer for a while.

Wow, strange things are happening.  Somehow nasty words are substituted for two letters that are supposed to come after LMS-332 C  I made several attempts to change, but was unsuccessful.  I was unable to list the entire description of the Lowrance unit.
thanks for the offer Connie, Simon, I will check and see if my son still has his defective puck and see what it looks like if he has it. I will get back to you asap.    No problem

so today I went out and put a new battery in my skiff and fired up the depth finder / gps my son gave me. only one problem, it wouldn't turn on. I have power to the end of the power cord going into the unit but zip to turn it on. so I guess my son thought his problem was the puck when it really could have been the 332 unit itself.  so thanks to everyone for the advice and offers of help, I guess I will put an old depth finder I have in the basement on the boat and use it for the rest of the season
